intro: Calendula hybrida, commonly known as pot marigold, is a flowering plant in the sunflower family (Asteraceae). It is native to the Mediterranean region and is characterized by its bright orange to yellow flowers with prominent central disks. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has hairy, lobed leaves that are aromatic when crushed. Its flowers bloom from late spring to early autumn, and the plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value and medicinal properties. Calendula hybrida is also used in skincare products and as a natural dye due to its rich pigment content.
